body:
> Couldn't we just track registered watchers in the add-on and clean them up ourselves?

We can do this for when the entire add-on gets removed. I'm more worried about keeping sandboxes alive after recipe execution but while the add-on is loaded. It sounds like that is going to be required though, since the action is going to have a pretty active involvement in the experiment.

Should we lower the 5 minute delay from startup, and instead delay heartbeats by 5 minutes? It sounds beneficial to have these experiments run sooner.
